data.title: Submit music for review by the most famous producers — SongChecks
data.meta_description: SongChecks is a curated platform for indie music makers to get song and mix feedback from the world’s leading music producers, as well as the best mix and mastering engineers.
data.text:
Choose from these Award Winning producers, mixers, and mastering engineers.

Get expert feedback on how to improve the music you’re working on!

Pop

Hip Hop

R&B

Rock

Alternative

Electronic

Punk

Metal

Folk

Country

Latin

Dance

Mastering Engineers

$149

$99

Kevin 'KD' Davis

LA-based Grammy award-winning mix engineer Kevin ‘KD’ Davis first came to prominence in 1995 when he mixed Gangsta's Paradise, the worldwide hit by Coolio. Born into a musical upbringing with a record producer father and songwriter mother, since going freelance, KD has mixed hits for artists as diverse as Outkast, Ne-Yo, Céline Dion, Dionne Warwick, Usher, Mariah Carey, Pink, Chris Brown, India Arie, and Sam Smith (Dancing With A Stranger).

Mark Needham

Mark Needham is a mixer, producer, and engineer, with eleven Grammy nominations for his work on music by Shakira, Pink, Chris Isaak, Chris Tomlin, and The Killers (famously, he mixed Mr. Brightside in approximately 40 minutes). His credits also include work for legendary artists like Fleetwood Mac, Imagine Dragons, Dolly Parton, Walk the Moon, Moby, The Airborne Toxic Event, and more. (Photo by Mark V. Lord)

Howie Weinberg

With fifteen Grammys and over 32 Grammy nominations, four TEC Awards, two Juno awards, a Mercury Prize, more than 200 Gold and Platinum records, over 19,000 total credits, and 25 billion streams, Howie Weinberg has opened a truly unique mastering studio in historic Laurel Canyon complete with the most advanced digital and analog equipment in the world and serving both major labels and indie artists.

Chris Shaw

Four-time Grammy-winning producer and mixer Chris Shaw got his start at Greene Street Recording, where he worked with hip-hop legends such as Run-DMC, A Tribe Called Quest, Public Enemy, and LL Cool J. Since going independent, Shaw has made records with Bob Dylan, Leonard Cohen, Jeff Buckley, Lou Reed, and Cheap Trick, with a discography that includes six of the 500 Greatest Albums of All Time as listed by Rolling Stone magazine.

Dave Way

Four-time Grammy winner Dave Way has mixed and produced dozens of multi-Platinum albums for artists such as Ringo Starr, Ziggy Marley, P!nk, Sheryl Crow, Ben Folds, John Doe, Weird Al, Cat Power, Michael Jackson, Paul McCartney, Fiona Apple, Macy Gray, Foo Fighters, Prince, and TLC. He also mixed the scores for Echo in The Canyon, Flag Day, Reminiscence, and Stand Up Guys. Way is currently mixing projects in Dolby Atmos.

Steve Thompson

Seven-time Grammy winner Steve Thompson is a writer, producer, mixer, and remixer. His work has helped sell more than 350 million units across 150 plus Diamond, Platinum, and Gold records. Thompson mixed tracks on Guns N' Roses' Appetite for Destruction, Metallica's And Justice for All, and Butthole Surfer's Electriclarryland. He also produced Korn's Follow the Leader. Other credits include John Lennon, Wu-Tang Clan, and Madonna.

Shelly Yakus

Shelly Yakus is a renowned audio engineer and mixer. He has worked on recordings for some of music's most prominent artists, including John Lennon, Stevie Nicks, Alice Cooper, Van Morrison, Tom Petty, Dire Straits, Blue Oyster Cult, Bob Seger, Don Henley, U2, Madonna, and Ramones. The music Yakus has engineered and mixed has grossed over a billion dollars in worldwide sales, and he was nominated for the Rock and Roll hall of fame by Bono from U2.

Chris Kimsey

Chris Kimsey has worked in the recording industry for 45 years having started his career at Olympic Studios under the tutorage of Keith Grant, Jimmy Miller, and Glyn Johns. Within his first few years, he had worked with the likes of The Rolling Stones, Led Zeppelin, and B. B. King. His association with The Rolling Stones lasted over 25 years. Other credits include The Psychedelic Furs, Yes, The Cult, Duran Duran, INXS, and 5.1 sound for Elton John, Dire Straits, Genesis, and Phil Collins.

Lu Diaz

Mix engineer and producer Lu Diaz has three Grammy wins and more than 50 Gold and Platinum awards. Over the years he has worked with artists such as Lauryn Hill, The Bahamen, Mary J Blige, Beyonce, P Diddy, 50 Cent, DJ Khaled, and Kodak Black. Along with his brother, Hugo, Diaz forms half of The Diaz Brothers. They signed and launched the career of Pitbull and are considered architects of the modern Miami music landscape.

Tucker Martine

Tucker Martine is a Grammy-nominated producer, engineer, and musician. Over his 25 year career, he has worked with artists such as R.E.M., First Aid Kit, My Morning Jacket, Neko Case, Bill Frisell, Calexico, Grandaddy, Mavis Staples, The Avett Brothers, Spoon, KD Lang, Mudhoney, She & Him, Modest Mouse, Sufjan Stevens, and M Ward. He is now based in Northeast Portland where his studio, Flora Recording and Playback, is also located.

Matt Wallace

Producer and mixer, Matt Wallace, is widely known for his work with Faith No More, Maroon 5, The Replacements, and Train. Wallace produced most of Faith No More's most iconic recordings, including their debut, We Care a Lot, and their breakthrough album, The Real Thing, featuring the mega-hit, Epic. Wallace also produced and mixed Songs About Jane, the debut album for Maroon 5, which has sold over ten million copies.

Ross Hogarth

Ross Hogarth is a multi-Grammy, multi-Platinum, Pensado Award-winning producer and mixer whose oeuvre runs from classic rock to heavy metal. He’s worked with iconic acts such as Van Halen, REM, Jewel, The Black Crowes, Motley Crue, John Mellencamp, Roger Waters, and Melissa Etheridge. His credits include Slow Down, Keb' Mo's Grammy-winning Best Contemporary Blues Album and Love is My Religion, Ziggy Marley’s Grammy-winning reggae record.

Richard Furch

Richard Furch has worked on some of the most iconic albums of the 2000s, including Grammy winners Confessions by Usher and Speakerboxxx/The Love Below by Outkast. With over 25 million records sold, he has worked on six Grammy-winning albums. Furch continues to mix in stereo and Dolby Atmos Spatial for legends such as Prince, Steve Aoki, and Snoop Dogg, as well as A-list artists in the Asian market such as JJ Lin, G.E.M., and Jolin Tsai.

Matt Lawrence

Matt Lawrence is a Grammy-winning, multi-Platinum mixer, producer, and engineer who has worked on some of the most influential records of the past 20 years, contributing to millions of record sales worldwide. He was Chief Engineer at London’s Metropolis studios before moving into production alongside his mix work. Records he’s been a part of include artists such as Adele, Amy Winehouse, Bjork, DJ Shadow, Grinderman, Keane, Lady Gaga, Laura Marling, Mumford & Sons.

Tim Palmer

Tim Palmer has produced and mixed albums for a huge selection of classic and alternative artists, from David Bowie and Tears For Fears to Ozzy Osbourne, and U2. He has had Top Ten albums in the UK for five decades. Amongst many notable credits, Palmer mixed Ten for Pearl Jam, which is now in the top 50 best-selling albums of all time, and was nominated for a Grammy for his mixing work on U2’s All That You Can’t Leave Behind.

F. Reid Shippen

With eleven Grammy-winning albums and a hundred plus number one singles, mixer and producer F. Reid Shippen has worked with a diverse range of artists across all genres, including Dierks Bentley, Mickey Guyton, Kenny Chesney, Jelly Roll, Steven Tyler, and Cage the Elephant. Shippen is a partner at The Music Playground NYC and a co-founder of SongFarm, a charity that builds recording studios in underserved high schools. (Photo by Max Hsu)

Ali Stone

Colombian multi-Platinum producer and singer-songwriter Ali Stone was named by Billboard as one of the Latin Hitmakers of 2021. She has worked on Grammy-nominated albums, remixed top artists such as Katy Perry, and produced for RBD, Alok, and Mary J. Blige. Stone performed on Justin Bieber's Purpose World Tour. Her self-produced, mixed, and mastered debut album, Sexto Sentido, hit number one on the Electronic Charts.

Rich Keller

With six Grammy nominations, 35 Platinum albums, and over 75 million albums sold, Rich Keller has continued to be a first call mixer and producer for hip hop and R&B legends like Snoop Dogg, DMX, Jay Z, Alicia Keys, Swizz Beatz, Lil Wayne, Mariah Carey, Method Man, Rick Ross, and many others. Keller attended North Texas State University and the City College of New York, where he studied jazz bass with the legendary Ron Carter.

Mike Plotnikoff

Mike Plotnikoff is a producer and mixer who started his career assisting on major albums for AC/DC, Cher, and Aerosmith. He then spent 8 years as Bruce Fairbairn’s chief engineer, working on recording for artists such as Van Halen, INXS, Kiss, Yes, and Bryan Adams. Plotnikoff has since worked with producer Howard Benson on some of the biggest albums of the 2000s including releases by Papa Roach and Hoobastank.

Brent Kolatalo

With sixteen years of experience making hit records, New York-based mix engineer and producer Brent Kolatalo has worked on more than 24 Gold and Platinum albums, nineteen number one albums and singles, and sixteen Grammy-nominated albums. His resume is eclectic and includes credits for Kanye West, Eminem, Bruno Mars, Jay-Z, Lorde, Drake, Lenny Kravitz, One Republic, Lana Del Rey, and Lady Gaga.

Chris Coady

Chris Coady has been one of the most notable indie-rock producers and mixing engineers over the past twenty years. He did some early work with The Yeah Yeah Yeahs, tracking Show Your Bones and mastering Fever to Tell. He also engineered Desperate Youth and Return to Cookie Mountain for TV On The Radio, mixed Grizzly Bear's Yellow House, and produced and mixed four Beach House albums — from Teen Dream to Thank You Lucky Stars.

Brian Lucey

A former artist and mixer, Brian Lucey’s mastering credits includes Grammy winners, Billboard, Amazon, and iTunes number ones. Partial credits feature In The Heights, VIVO, Atomic Blonde, Cats, The Greatest Showman Soundtracks. The Black Keys, Arctic Monkeys, Marilyn Manson, Depeche Mode, Green Day, Liam Gallagher, Chet Faker, Elvis Costello, Shania Twain, Lucinda Williams, Katy Perry, The Shins, Dr. John, and Juanes, a 2021 Latin Grammy nominee. Lucey is also available to give Atmos feedback.

Kevin Churko

Canadian-bred, Las Vegas-based producer and mix engineer Kevin Churko works out of his private studio, The Hideout. Having learned the art of music production under the tutelage of world-renowned producer, Mutt Lange, Churko’s credits include Ozzy Osbourne, Papa Roach, Modern Science, Five Finger Death Punch, Disturbed, In This Moment, Shania Twain, and Hellyeah. He has been nominated for eight Juno Awards (Canadian Grammy) and has won four times.

Marc DeSisto

Starting at A&M Studio, producer and mix engineer Marc De Sisto learned from a number of legendary producers including Jimmy Iovine, Shelly Yakus, and Mike Shipley. He assisted on seminal albums such as Pink Floyd’s Momentary Lapse of Reason and Tom Petty’s Let Me Up, engineered on U2’s Rattle and Hum and Don Henley's The End Of The Innocence, and was Grammy-nominated for Best Rock Album for Melissa Etheridge’s Breakdown.

Dave Schiffman

As Rick Rubin’s engineer, Dave Schiffman worked on seminal albums in the late 90s and early 2000s such as Californication by Red Hot Chili Peppers and Toxicity by System of a Down. Now a Grammy-winning, multi-Platinum selling producer, mixer, and engineer, his discography includes The Strumbellas, Vampire Weekend, Adele, Jimmy Eat World, HAIM, Hozier, Limp Bizkit, Weezer, Nine Inch Nails, and Alanis Morrisette.

Gordon Raphael

Producer Gordon Raphael is widely known for his work with The Strokes, whom he first met at a gig in New York City. He produced their debut EP, The Modern Age, and their first two albums, Is This It and Room on Fire. Other prominent production credits include Sarah Maguire, Damon Albarn, The Moonies, leading Mexican rock band Fobia, and Regina Spektor's album, Soviet Kitsch. Raphael also toured as a member of The Psychedelic Furs.

Gareth Jones

Producer and mixer Gareth Jones is a pioneer in using digital equipment to produce music, having combined digital tools with analog recording techniques and synthesizers since the 1980s. Jones produced five albums for legendary electronic group Depeche Mode, six albums for synth-pop superstars Erasure, and multiple recordings for Wire, Einsturzende Neubauten, Diamanda Galas, Interpol, The Futureheads, and Liars.

Dan Korneff

Dan Korneff is a producer and mixer with an extensive discography featuring some of the biggest names in new rock such as My Chemical Romance, Paramore, Pierce the Veil, Papa Roach, Breaking Benjamin, and Sleeping With Sirens. Korneff works out of his own studio space, Sonic Debris Recording Studio, in New York’’s Long Island. In addition, Korneff is the owner and developer at Korneff Audio, producing a selection of custom plugins.

Danny Kalb

While at The Boat in Los Angeles, Danny Kalb engineered music by Beck, Dust Brothers, Jack Johnson, Karen O, and Rilo Kiley before becoming a freelance producer. Since then, he has produced or mixed recordings for Ben Harper, Neon Neon, Dreamers, Foster The People, Hirie, They Might Be Giants, The Green, The Movement, Elovaters, and Little Stranger. Kalb has also mastered music for Steve Lacy, Domo Genesis, and The Polar Boys.

Dave Fortman

In addition to being the guitarist for Ugly Kid Joe, Dave Fortman is also a producer and mixer with credits with numerous high-profile acts, including Slipknot, Godsmack, Simple Plan, Superjoint Ritual, Otep, Watership Down, Mudvayne, and Eyehategod. He has also worked on two of Evanescence's multi-Platinum selling albums, Fallen and The Open Door. Fortman co-owns a recording studio in Louisiana called Balance Productions.

Maor Appelbaum

Mastering engineer Maor Appelbaum is the owner of Maor Appelbaum Mastering in LA. He uses a hybrid combination of analog and digital equipment including custom-built hardware and modified gear that has been designed especially for him. Appelbaum's extensive discography spans thousands of songs and includes music by Yes, Meatloaf, Dream Theater, Rob Halford, Starset, Faith No More, Sepultura, Matisyahu, Walter Trout, William Shatner, and Limp Bizkit.

Chris Sheldon

London-based producer and mixer Chris Sheldon has worked on numerous groundbreaking rock albums for acts such as the Foo Fighters (mixing The Colour and The Shape), Feeder, Skunk Anansie, and Biffy Clyro. Starting as a tea boy at Utopia Studios in the 1980s, Sheldon continues to work closely with producer Giles Martin, engineering and mixing tracks for the Rocketman soundtrack. He also produced and mixed the latest Therapy? album. (Photo by Marcus Maschwitz)

Clarke Schleicher

Mix engineer and producer Clarke Schleicher has worked on more than twenty number one singles and ten number one albums spanning multiple genres. He’s won three Grammys and has been nominated for ACM Engineer of the Year twice. Schleicher’s extensive discography includes Neil Young, Amy Grant, Joan Baez, Taylor Swift, Blake Shelton, Faith Hill, Dixie Chicks, Lady Antebellum, and Marie Osmond.

Maria Elisa Ayerbe

Miami-based Maria Elisa Ayerbe is Latin Grammy winner (in 2021 for Mixing Engineer) and a multiple Latin Grammy-nominated producer, engineer, and composer. She has been involved in music production for artists like Mary J Blige, Ricky Martin, Marc Anthony, JLo, New Kids on the Block, and Kronos Quartet. In 2019, Maria Elisa was recognized by the Latin Recording Academy with the Leading Ladies of Entertainment honor for her work inspiring the next generation of female leaders.

Alan Branch

Alan Branch is a Grammy-winning mixer and producer based in London. He’s worked with a wide array of world-renowned artists including U2, Jeff Beck, Sinead O'Connor, Nine Inch Nails, Boy George, Primal Scream, Sade, and The Cure. Amongst other notable credits Branch mixed Asian Dub Foundation’s 1000 Mirrors, remixed Depeche Mode’s Barrel of a Gun, produced Atari Teenage Riot’s Delete Yourself, and was an engineer and mixer on Blur’s 1997 self-titled album.

Howard Willing

Howard ‘The Bear’ Willing is a Grammy-winning producer, mixer, and engineer. He has worked with artists such as The Chicks, Gavin Degraw, Stevie Nicks, Tupac Shakur, Ida Mae, Smashing Pumpkins, Cheap Trick, Ok Go, Counting Crows, Sheryl Crow, The Wallflowers, Kris Kristofferson, Snoop Dog, Sara Bareilles, and Macy Gray. Willing has also been a collaborator with the Smashing Pumpkins, and frontman Billy Corgan, for decades.

Steve Marcantonio

During his 40 years in the music industry, producer and mixer Steve Marcantonio has worked with artists of the caliber of Taylor Swift, John Lennon, Steven Tyler, Kiss, Heart, Ronnie Dunn, Keith Urban, and Reba McEntire. He won his Grammy in 2015 for Best Compilation Soundtrack for Visual Media for his work on Glen Campbell: I'll Be Me. He also worked on Red by Taylor Swift, nominated in 2013 for Album of the Year.

Preston 'Prizzie' Reid

Preston 'Prizzie’ Reid is a mixing engineer and producer who got his start under engineer Thom ‘TK’ Kidd and hit mixer Miles Walker. Prizzie became a full-time mixer/producer in 2018 and in 2021 contributed to Kanye West’s critically acclaimed Donda album, which has since been nominated for two Grammy awards, and also worked on Muni Long's Billboard-topping PDA album which featured Platinum-selling single Hrs & Hrs.

John Goodmanson

With hundreds of albums to his name, John Goodmanson is a record producer, recording engineer, and mixer based in Seattle and best known for his work with a number of pioneering indie bands. Goodmanson has produced and mixed albums by Death Cab for Cutie, Wu-Tang Clan, Owl City, Rogue Wave, Pavement, ​​Sleater-Kinney, Los Campesinos!, Nada Surf, Blonde Redhead, Weezer, Hanson, Blondie, Train, and Bikini Kill.

Steve Fisk

Producer, mixer, and composer Steve Fisk is a legend of the Pacific Northwest rock scene. He recorded several tracks for Nirvana's Blew EP, performed as one half of Pigeonhed, and worked with seminal underground acts such as Screaming Trees, Tree People, The Afghan Whigs, and Boss Hog. Fisk also produced the BIG Car Seat Headrest record, Teens of Denial, and worked with Soundgarden since their second release, Fopp, in 1988.

Mark Rankin

Two-time Grammy-winning producer and mix engineer Mark Rankin has worked with numerous A-list artists such as Adele, Queens Of The Stone Age, Iggy Pop, Weezer, Florence And The Machine and Foster The People. Rankin won two Grammys in 2012 for his work on Adele's album, 21, and her single, ‘Rolling in the Deep’. He also received two Grammy nominations for the Queens of the Stone Age album ...Like Clockwork. (Photo by Andreas Neumann)

Billy Decker

Billy Decker is a country music mixer, engineer, and producer with sixteen Billboard number ones to his name, including Riding Roads by Dustin Lynch. Decker's mixes have appeared on albums that have sold over 50 million units. An RIAA-certified mixer, he's worked with Sam Hunt, Chris Young, Rodney Atkins, Dustin Lynch, Parmalee, Colt Ford, and Darius Rucker. Decker also mixed George Jones's last album before his passing in 2013.

Richard Chycki

Multi-Platinum mixer, engineer, and producer Richard Chycki is highly regarded for his work with rock icons Rush, Aerosmith, Skillet, Dream Theater, Pink, Seal, and Mick Jagger. He has undertaken groundbreaking immersive work in multichannel audio for Rush, Evanescence, and The Tragically Hip. Chycki has also contributed to a number of movie soundtracks as well as doing surround mixes for P. Diddy and Sean Paul.

Esjay Jones

Yucca Valley-based, Grammy-featured metal and rock producer Esjay Jones has worked with songwriters and artists such as Billy Corgan, Dave Navarro, Grey Daze (Chester Bennington) Krewella, Justin Tranter, Head (Korn), Jasen Rauch (Breaking Benjamin), Alien Ant Farm, Mike Elizondo, Nile Rodgers, and The Underdogs. She is also the songwriter, producer, guitarist and vocalist for the band We Are PIGS.

Jacob Hansen

Working out of Hansen Studios in Denmark, Grammy-nominated Jacob Hansen has produced, engineered, mixed, and mastered some of the biggest acts in alternative and heavy music. His credits include Amaranthe, Volbeat, Dizzy Mizz Lizzy, The Black Dahlia Murder, Pretty Maids, Epica, Fleshgod Apocalypse, Primal Fear, and Evergrey. Hansen has also played guitar and provided vocals for the band Invocator since 1985.

Guy Massey

Guy Massey is a Grammy and multi-Award-winning producer and mixer. He has a long history with Abbey Road Studios and is now based in his own Mix Room in North London. Massey has worked with The Beatles, Paul Simon, Ed Sheeran, Manic Street Preachers, Ray Davies, and Bill Fay, amongst others. Recent credits include an eclectic mix of Spiritualized, The Divine Comedy, Rocket Man and Yesterday movies, Kylie Minogue, Michael Price, and McFly.

R. Walt Vincent

Los Angeles-based producer and mix engineer R. Walt Vincent has worked on seminal recordings for indie rock icons Pete Yorn, Liz Phair, and Tommy Keene. His collaborations with Yorn included mixing and co-producing Yorn's 2001 debut musicforthemorningafter, which was also co-produced by Brad Wood and featured the hits Life on a Chain and Strange Condition. Other notable credits include Liz Phair, Alanis Morissette, Gush, and Crosstide.

Michael Romanowski

Michael Romanowski is a Grammy-nominated mastering engineer and the owner of Coast Mastering. He is also co-founder of the tape-based label, The Tape Project. In addition to his extensive mastering credits, Romanowski is also a pioneer in immersive audio and Immersive Mastering. He is a current Trustee for the Recording Academy, a member of the P&E Advisory Council, and a member of the AES Technical committee.

Brian Reeves

Muti-Platinum mixer and producer Brian Reeves has more than forty years of experience in the music industry working with producers such as Giorgio Moroder, Jimmy Iovine, Harold Faltermeyer, and Keith Forsey, and artists of the caliber of Billy Idol, U2, Donna Summer, The Pet Shop Boys, Miley Cyrus, and Kenny Loggins. Reeves’s engineering career began at Westlake Recording Studios in Hollywood where he engineered sessions for Billy Idol and Donna Summer.

Josh Gannet

Josh Gannet is a New Jersey-based producer, mixer, and engineer. His discography includes production and mixing work for legendary hip-hop group Wu-Tang Clan on their album The Saga Continues (2017), released to considerable critical acclaim. Gannet has also worked with Redman (2015's Mudface), French Montana, and Method Man. More recently, he produced and mixed the album Ghostface Killahs for Ghostface Killah (2019).

Travis Ference

Travis Ference is a Grammy-nominated mixer, producer, and recording engineer based out of Los Angeles. With nearly two decades of experience in the record business, he has worked on multiple number one albums, several top 10's, numerous RIAA Platinum and Gold certified records, as well as hit TV shows and blockbuster films. His work can be heard on more than 15 million albums sold worldwide and over one billion streams.

Steve Churchyard

Steve Churchyard is a producer, engineer, and mixer who began his career at Sir George Martin’s AIR Studios. He has won two Latin Grammys: for Juanes' album La Vida… Es Un Ratico, and Paraíso Express by Alejandro Sanz. Churchyard also received Grammy nominations for Katy Perry's album Teenage Dream and Jason Mraz's Love Is a Four-Letter Word. Other notable credits include INXS, The Eagles, Billy Joel, Sex Pistols, The Pretenders, The Stranglers, and Adele.

Jett Galindo

Los Angeles mastering engineer and vinyl cutter Jett Galindo has worked on a wide array of Grammy-winning albums. Prior to The Bakery, Galindo worked at the famed Mastering Lab as Doug Sax’s last protégé. There she worked on various notable vinyl releases including Pink Floyd’s final album, Endless River. Outside the studio, Galindo writes about mastering for various websites (iZotope LEARN portal, and SoundGirls).

Alex Aldi

Producer and mixer Alex Aldi started as a staff engineer at Gigantic Studios where he worked on Holy Ghost!’s self-titled album, Passion Pit’s Manners, and The Walkmen’s You and Me. In 2010, Aldi set up The Glass Factory studio in Brooklyn and went onto produce and mix Passion Pit’s albums Kindred and Gossamer, Troye Sivan’s For Him, and Bad W’ Zombie, nominated for Rock Song of the Year at the 2019 iHeartRadio Music Awards.

Danny Briottet

DJ, producer, and remixer Danny Briottet was a founding member of UK electronic music pioneers, Renegade Soundwave (RSW), who were a major influence on artists like The Prodigy and Chemical Brothers. Briottet’s production and remix credits include Depeche Mode, Cypress Hill, Radiohead, Moby, and Orbital. In addition to DJing globally, Briottet is Director of Music Programmes for the’s European Centre for Peace & Development.

Gary Stevenson

Gary Stevenson has produced an incredible array of projects: from defining the mid-80s sound of Go West to producing ABC’s The Lexicon Of Love II, the follow-up to one of the most iconic LPs ever released. During Stevenson’s career he has produced albums and soundtracks with artists including Rick Astley, ABC, Go West, Tony Hadley, Bros, Beverley Craven, Snakecharmer, and an American Billboard number-one single Angel with The Jones Gang.

Colin Richardson

Colin Richardson is a UK-based mixer and producer who has worked with some of the most iconic acts in the metal genre, including Carcass, Napalm Death, Machine Head, and Slipknot. He has been involved in over a hundred albums with notable productions, including Sepultura, Fear Factory, and Bullet For My Valentine. Richardson recently produced and mixed House of Noise by Massive Wagons - a UK Top Ten album.

Sally Browder

Los Angeles-based producer, engineer, and mixer Sally Browder has three decades of experience and credits with artists such as Dwight Yoakam, The Red Aunts, Curt Kirkwood (Meat Puppets), Rocket from the Crypt, and Amy Rigby. Influential music publication MOJO Magazine once famously referred to Browder's 'knuckle punch sound.' Browder works across all genres, from singer-songwriters to country and punk bands.

Simon Hanhart

Simon Hanhart is a music producer, mixer, and engineer based in London. Starting as an assistant engineer at Marquee Studios, Hanhart worked with leading producers such as Mutt Lange and Gus Dudgeon. Since then, he has worked with a diverse array of acts including Asia, Marillion, David Bowie, and Yngwie Malmsteen. Hanhart also co-produced, engineered, and mixed Perfect Day, one of the best-selling UK singles of all time.

Pascal Gabriel

Over a career spanning thirty years, songwriter and producer Pascal Gabriel has worked on everything from S-Express's number one song, Theme from S-Express, Bomb The Bass's album, Beat Dis, EMF's multi-Platinum, Schubert Dip, and Dido's global hits Here With Me and No Angel. Other notable credits include remixes for Can, New Order, Erasure and Yello, writing for Kylie Minogue, and producing and writing for Goldfrapp, Miss Kittin, and Little Boots.

Yang Tan

Yang Tan is a mixer and vocal engineer at Paramount Recording Studios and the owner of Absolute Magnitude Entertainment Records. She has taken her skill for orchestral arrangements and morphed it into a successful career as a mixer working with artists like Kanye West, Kid Cudi, Stephanie Poetri, J. Cole, Pentatonix, and K-pop artist Jackson Wang. Tan was recently featured in Variety as a Hitmaker Engineer.

Bryan Cook

La-based mixer Bryan Cook has 20 years of experience in the studio world, having started at the legendary A&M Studios. While there, he worked with artists like Rod Stewart, The Wallflowers, and Korn. Since going independent in 2002, Cook has mixed music for some of rock and pop's most notable names, including U2, One Republic, and Jeff Goldblum. He also recorded Fleet Foxes, Iggy Pop, and Autolux for Nigel Godrich's 'From the Basement’ series.

Major Seven

Omar Walker, a.k.a. ‘Major Seven’, is a hip-hop producer from Atlanta who first came to mainstream attention for producing the song The Devil Is a Lie, the lead single for the Rick Ross album, Mastermind. Subsequent credits for the multi-Platinum producer include Jay-Z, Future, Rihanna, DJ Khaled, Buju, DJ Snake, Blackpink, Ozuna, Megan The Stallion, Bryson Tiller, T-Pain, Kodak Black, Dave East, Jacquees, Tech N9ne, Wale, Boys II Men, and Verse Simmonds.

Rob Kleiner

Rob Kleiner is a four-time Grammy-nominated songwriter, producer, mixing, and mastering engineer. Based in LA, Kleiner has established himself as a sought-after creative whose collaborations can be heard on music by artists such as Sia, Labrinth, Cee Lo, Andra Day, Foxy Shazam, Atlas Genius, Haley Reinhart, ZZ Ward, and LP. As the owner of SE Mastering, Kleiner has also done mixing and mastering for HBO's Euphoria and The Deadpool soundtrack.

Howard Redekopp

Howard Redekopp is a Juno-winning producer, mixer, writer, musician, and engineer based in Vancouver. He has worked on critically acclaimed recordings for Tegan and Sara (including their breakthrough single, So Jealous), The New Pornographers, Mother Mother, La Gusana Ciega, Hannah Georgas, The Zolas, Nathan, An Horse, and Now, Now. Redekopp's Grammy nominations include albums by La Gusana Ciega and Margaret Cho.

Kane Churko

Multi-platinum Juno award-winning producer and songwriter Kane Churko has worked with leading acts such as Papa Roach, Five Finger Death Punch, In This Moment, Ozzy Osbourne, and VAMPS. Churko became the youngest person to win the Juno Award for Engineer of the Year for his work on In This Moment's ‘Blood’/Five Finger Death Punch's ‘Coming Down’. He is also the frontman and songwriter for the Juno nominated band Modern Science.

George Shilling

Recording, mix and mastering engineer, producer, and musician George Shilling engineered the global hit The Only Way Is Up by Yazz, then produced and engineered the Soup Dragons’ hit I’m Free. Shilling subsequently worked on influential albums by Bernard Butler, Teenage Fanclub, and Primal Scream (mixing their seminal single Kowalski), Texas, Blur, Steve Winwood, and Tony Iommi. More recently he worked with Frank Turner and Dire Straits’ David Knopfler.

Carl Glanville

Multiple Grammy and Emmy-winning producer and mixer Carl Glanville has worked with some of music’s luminaries including Michael Jackson and Billy Joel. Glanville collected two Grammys over a fifteen-year relationship with U2, as well as a Grammy nomination for his engineering work on Jason Mraz's Mr. A-Z. He was a producer, engineer, and one of the mixers on U2’s album, How to Dismantle an Atomic Bomb, and mixed Billy Joel’s live concert album,12 Gardens Live.

Carmen Rizzo

Two-time Grammy-nominated producer and writer Carmen Rizzo has worked with artists of the caliber of Seal, Coldplay, Paul Oakenfold, Ryuichi Sakamoto, Pete Townshend, and Niyaz. In addition, he has composed music for Oscar-winning directors Michael Apted and Stanley Brooks and runs his own label, Electrofone Music. Rizzo was previously the Senior Artist Relations Manager at Native Instruments.

Ryan Gilligan

LA-based mix engineer Ryan Gilligan got his start at Electric Lady and Quad Studios in New York. He was mentored by legendary mixer Michael Brauer for more than seven years before relocating to LA in 2014 and establishing himself as a freelance mix engineer. Gilligan has been awarded three Grammy Certificates for work with John Mayer, Kanye West, and Calle 13. Other credits include Solange Knowles, Kevin Garrett, Twin Shadow, Wu-Tang, and Never Shout Never.

Martina Albano

Mastering engineer Martina Albano has served as both Vice President and Governor on the board of the Atlanta Chapter of The Recording Academy. In 2020, Albano co-founded the recording and mastering studio Onda Blu. Her mastering credits include Cassie, Jade Novah, Ro James, Theo Croker, Kameron Corvet, ony League, Nate Butler, Olivia Castriota, NONIE, Sailing to Denver, Seersha, and Zabaduo.

Carlos Castro

Carlos Castro is an LA-based music producer, mixer, and audio engineer. During his thirty years of working in the music industry, he has won dozens of awards and recognitions from major international music organizations, including 13 Latin Grammy nominations. Castro is the owner of Watersound Studios (located in Studio City), a state-of-the-art vintage analog recording studio. His credits include Selena Gomez, Demi Lovato, Shawn Colvin, and Luis Miguel.

Matt Sim

Having started at New York’s Hit Factory, Hong Kong-based Matt Sim is an award-winning mixer and producer responsible for countless global chart-topping successes. Since 2015, he has mixed over 1,000 songs spanning all genres with artists such as Jojo Siwa, Jackson Wang, PH-1, Nafla, Tia Ray, Theo Croker, GEM, and Aya Nakamura. His work has earned him multiple Grammy nominations and international music awards. Sim also does extensive mix work in Dolby Atmos.

VRB Tunes

Orlando Vitto and Renzo Bravo are a Platinum-certified production duo based in Miami and widely known for their work in Latin pop. Since partnering up in early 2020, Vitto and Renzo (aka VRB Tunes) have been a prominent force in the Latin music industry, collaborating with established acts such as Latin Grammy nominee Lasso, multi-Platinum vocalist Cami, American-Dominican songwriter, Sharlene, and rising pop star Samantha Sanchez.

Daniel 'Vago' Galindo

Daniel ‘Vago’ Galindo is a Grammy nominated and Latin Grammy winning engineer, mixer and producer who has worked with an impressive list of artists including Juanes, Elvis Costello, Sin Bandera, Guaynaa, Francisca Valenzuela, RBD, Eugenio Derbez, Alejandra Guzman, La Marisoul, and Vale. Vago has also worked in the film industry as an engineer for movie soundtracks such as La La Land, The Girl in the Spider’s Web and Beauty and The Beast.

Jeremy Brown

Jeremy Brown is a producer and mix engineer from Atlanta. With Andrew Foah, he is the co-owner of hereIR Productions, a full-service music production facility specializing in pop and urban music. Brown worked with The-Dream and Tricky Stewart between 2014 and 2019, playing multiple different roles from production assistant to recording engineer. During that time he worked with Alicia Keys, Beyoncé, Nipsey Hussle, Future, and Usher.

Ignacio 'Nacho' Molino

Producer and mix engineer Ignacio Molino has won three Grammys and five Latin Grammys, his first in 2015 for his work on Ruben Blades’ album Son de Panama. Having started as an active member of the Panamanian rock scene, over the past 18 years Nacho has worked with artists such as CJ Ramone, Ruben Blades, Carlos Vives, Gente de Zona, Pacific Broders, Pedro Arroyo, Luis Enrique, Angel Lopez, and Rod Richards from Rare Earth.

Adrian Hall

Since going freelance in 2004, Adrian Hall has been an in-demand mixer, engineer, and producer. His credits span big-name artists such as Tori Amos, Depeche Mode, Goldfrapp, The Black Eyed Peas, Alicia Keys, Robbie Williams, Shakira, and Robyn as well as more independent acts like Anna Calvi, Big Deal, Young Knives, and Amber Run. Hall has mixed major live releases in both 5.1 and stereo for Depeche Mode, Robbie Williams, Shakira, and Youssou N’Dour.

Martin Cooke

Texas native Martin Cooke got his start at Henson Recording Studios in Los Angeles. Between 2013 and 2018, he engineered for legendary producer and mixer Rich Costey, working on songs for artists such as HAIM, Phantogram, Chvrches, and Foster The People. Now working as an independent engineer, mixer, and producer, Cooke’s credits include Death Cab for Cutie (Grammy Nomination in 2015), Of Monsters And Men, At The Drive-In, Kimbra, Sea Wolf, and Cathedrals.

Manny Nieto

As the leader of the bands The Chavez Ravine and Distortion Felix, Manny Nieto has gone on to have a long career recording and producing bands such as The Breeders, Los Lobos, Health, and David Kilgour. He’s currently featured regularly on Produce Like A Pro hosted by Warren Huart and is a featured artist at Earthquaker Devices, amongst other brands. Credits include Chokebore, The Breeders, Vaz, Health, Trash Talk, Los Lobos, Circle Jerks, Shifting Sands, Rough Church and Mean Reds.

Thiago Baggio

Thiago Baggio is a Sao Paulo-based five-time Latin Grammy-nominated recording and mixing engineer. Having started as an apprentice in 2010 he got his first big break as an Assistant Engineer in 2012 at the renowned studio NaCena. Since going freelance, Baggio has been awarded the title of Best Engineer in the 5º Music Pro Award, and is also a voting member of the Recording Academy, Latin Recording Academy and Audio Engineering Society.

Hans DeKline

Hans DeKline is a Grammy-winning (for Lisa Loeb’s Feel What U Feel) Los Angeles-based mastering engineer. Since 2005, he has mastered thousands of songs and albums by artists such as U2, Pixies, Veruca Salt, Lisa Loeb, Tim Finn, Ben Lee, The Von Bondies, and Steve Aoki. On average, DeKline masters around 1200 songs a year, calling upon his extensive musical background which includes being the former frontman of the indie band Maypole.

Russell Broom

Canadian songwriter, producer, and mix engineer Russell Broom is a winner of the JUNO Songwriter of the Year (with Jann Arden), has been JUNO nominated for Producer and Engineer of the Year, is a six-time WCMA Award winner, and two-time AMPIA Award winner. In addition to being the composer for season 3 of JANN on CTV/Hulu, Broom‘s recent productions include Jann Arden, Leeroy Stagger, The Dungarees, Jeffrey Straker, Sykamore, and Belle Starr.

Tyler Spratt

Tyler Spratt is an award-winning mixing engineer, producer, acoustician, and audio consultant. He received his Masters in Recording Arts and Technology from Middle Tennessee State University and went on to work at the historic Village Studios in West LA with artists such as Dave Matthews Band, Pierce The Veil, and Snoop Dogg. As a mixer, Spratt’s credits include Nadia Vaeh, Moby, The Brevet, Courtney Paige Neilson, The Frets, and Molly Moore.

Vic Cuccia

Vic Cuccia is a Los Angeles based, multi-Platinum engineer with over one billion Streams. Cuccia has worked with the likes of superstars Anitta, Rita Ora and Sofia Reyes, as well as TikTok star, Vaultboy. He has also worked with multi-Platinum producer duo The Fliptones, as well as engineered for Ty Dolla $ign as his vocal engineer in live concert settings. Other credits include Sarah Barrios, Katie Angel, Sophia Alexa, Jillian Rossi, Camila Fernandez, and The Fliptones.

Joseph Chudyk

Working out of a Dolby Atmos Enabled Music Studio in Rochester, NY, Joseph Chudyk recently mixed the Atmos/Spatial Audio versions for Kane Brown's single One Mississippi and Mitchell Tenpenny’s Midtown Diaries, including the hit single Truth About You. Many of Chudyk’s Dolby Atmos mixes are featured in Apple Music's Spatial Audio Playlists. Other credit s include Kane Brown, Mitchell Tenpenny, Joe Pug, and The National Reserve.

Luciano Tucunduva

Luciano Tucunduva is a music producer and mixing engineer based in São Paulo, Brazil. His work includes soundtracks, sound design, and mixing for Netflix, Globo, Warner, Discovery Kids, Cartoon Network, and Nickelodeon. As an audio engineer. Tucunduva worked on the series Clubversão (HBO), recording artists such as Gilberto Gil, and Milton Nascimento. Other credits include Lucas Gonçalves, Pélico, The Forgotten Men, and Mauro Motoki.

Tiago Casadei

Tiago Casadei is a Vitória-based recording, mixing, and mastering engineer. He graduated in music with a specialization in Brazilian popular music and jazz, and began his career as a recording musician and arranger in 2002 . Since then, Casadei has been involved in Gold-disc award-winning projects. He has dedicated himself to mixing and mastering in stereo and Atmos, and works across a variety of styles from pop and Latin to Indian music.
